definition: to become demoralized/to lose one's sense of purpose
to lose sth abstract but important (courage, authority, one's life etc)/to be bereaved of (one's spouse etc)/to die/disappointed/discouraged
lit. trifling destroys the will (idiom); infatuation with fine details prevents one making progress/excessive attention to trivia saps the will

sentences.english: Fathers, provoke not your children to indignation, lest they be discouraged.
sentences.chinese: 作父母的，不要激怒你們的子女，免得他們灰心喪志。

sentences.english: I agree playing games, because games relax people, but don't focus on it and lose you ambitious.
sentences.chinese: 我同意，因爲遊戲可以讓人放鬆，別玩物喪志就好。

sentences.english: You have turned into a man of doohickeys.
sentences.chinese: 你變成了一個玩物喪志的人。

sentences.english: Don't make a woman's compliment, but often make men grow weary.
sentences.chinese: 恭維不會使女人飄然，卻往往使男人喪志。

sentences.english: But ye, brethren, be not weary in well doing.
sentences.chinese: 弟兄們，你們行善不可喪志。

sentences.english: But let's not be disheartened and discouraged.
sentences.chinese: 可是，讓我們不要灰心喪志。

sentences.english: However, we respect so pessimistic and despondent pregnant worry about it?
sentences.chinese: 但是，我們是否就該因此悲觀而懷憂喪志呢？
